statement:
The right annihilator of a right $R$-module $M_R$ in $R$ is an ideal.

[**Proof:**]{}\
By the distributive law for modules, it is easy to see that
$\operatorname{r.ann}(M_R)$ is closed under addition and right
multiplication. Now take $x \in \operatorname{r.ann}(M_R)$ and
$r \in R$.

Take any $m \in M_R$. Then $mr \in M_R$, but then $(mr)x = 0$ since
$x \in \operatorname{r.ann}(M_R)$. So $m(rx)=0$ and
$rx \in \operatorname{r.ann}(M_R)$.

An equivalent result holds for left annihilators.
